intro: Sclerolepis verticillata, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features dense clusters of small, white to pink flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are leathery and arranged in whorls, giving it a distinctive appearance. Sclerolepis verticillata is adapted to grow in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions.
